clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment bacterial infections causing bronchitis prostatitis and urinary tract infections

contraindications.disease: Sulfamethazine may cause nausea vomiting diarrhea and hypersensitivity reactions Hematologic effects such as anemia agranulocytosis thrombocytopenia and hemolytic anemia in patients with glucose 6 phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency may also occur Sulfamethoxazole may displace bilirubin from albumin binding sites causing jaundice or kernicterus in newborns
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Sulfamethazine is a sulfonamide drug that inhibits bacterial synthesis of dihydrofolic acid by competing with para aminobenzoic acid PABA for binding to dihydropteroate synthetase dihydrofolate synthetase Sulfamethazine is bacteriostatic in nature Inhibition of dihydrofolic acid synthesis decreases the synthesis of bacterial nucleotides and DNA

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Nicotine
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Mecamylamine
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Pentolinium
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Trimethaphan
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Hexamethonium
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Cyclopentamine
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Methotrexate
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Ketoprofen is combined with Sulfamethazine
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Dexketoprofen is combined with Sulfamethazine
The risk or severity of renal failure can be increased when Sulfamethazine is combined with Cyclosporine

Colestipol can cause a decrease in the absorption of Sulfamethazine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
Sevelamer can cause a decrease in the absorption of Sulfamethazine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy

Cholestyramine can cause a decrease in the absorption of Sulfamethazine resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy
The serum concentration of Magnesium can be decreased when it is combined with Sulfamethazine
Sulfamethazine may decrease the excretion rate of Benzylpenicillin which could result in a higher serum level
